value.title: Architect solutions for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt:
A Solution Architect is responsible for the successful design, implementation, deployment, and adoption of an overall solution. A Solution Architect ensures that the solution meets the customer‚Äôs needs now and in the future. While the Solution Architect may not ‚Äúclick the buttons‚Äù during a deployment, they are ultimately responsible for the solution and work closely with the deployment team.
This learning path covers the pre-sales and analysis phases of a project to include:

What it takes to become a Solution Architect.
Discovering customer needs.
Proposing a solution.
Working with requirements.
Performing fit-gap analysis.

Instructor-led training (ILT) is scheduled for March 2020 that provides more hands-on activities and both this path and ILT are needed for the exam.

topItems.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

topItems.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

topItems.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

topItems.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer‚Äôs needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

topItems.title: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression
topItems.excerpt: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression Vertipaq is the database and engine that runs on top of Power BI and PowerPivot. topItems.title: New Power BI Experience in Microsoft Teams
topItems.excerpt: During this session, we will be talking about the new Power BI experience in Microsoft Teams. During Ignite 2020, Microsoft announced a feature that, users can use Power BI Service from teams without leaving the context of Teams.   This feature is very useful for modern workspace users where we can use

value.title: Power BI and PowerShell

topItems.title: Get Started with Power BI PowerShell | Install PowerShell Cmdlets for Power BI
topItems.excerpt: In this session, we will talk about how we can get started with the Power BI PowerShell. For any organization, if we wish to perform some admin related tasks easily and in faster manner, PowerShell is the best option. So many operations we can perform very easily and faster.  This is the first introduction

topItems.excerpt: During this video we will learn, how we can easily publish our Power BI report using PowerShell command. value.title: Embed Power BI
value.excerpt: The ability to embed Power BI into your site or application. This list has videos that are related to the different embedding options for Power BI. This includes Publish to web, the REST APIs and the Power BI Embedded Azure service.

topItems.title: What is Power BI Embedded?
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Adam, from Guy in a Cube, walks through what Power BI Embedded is. He talks about how you can get started with Power BI Embedded as well as what resources are available for you.  From the Azure portal to sample applications, along with documentation for APIs and usage of features, Adam
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iEHfUuoZseo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Create Power BI Embedded capacity in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Adam, from Guy in a Cube, walks through how to create Power BI Embedded capacity in the Microsoft Azure portal. He also takes a look at some of the actions you can do within the Azure portal such as scaling and pause/start.  Follow us on Twitter - https://twitter.com/mspowerbi  More questions?

topItems.title: 3 ways to embed Power BI

value.title: Power BI Administration
value.excerpt: This list includes all things related to administering Power BI. This includes dealing with licenses, working with Azure Active Directory and Office 365 and account issues.

topItems.title: Power BI Premium: What is V-CORE pooling?!?
topItems.excerpt: Adam breaks down v-core pooling with Power BI Premium. Explaining where the v-cores come from and how creating a Power BI Premium node affects the v-core pool. topItems.excerpt: Learn how you can block free signups for the Power BI service. Free signups are also what are referred to as viral signups. value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 1 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: As an administrator, how do you manage a Power BI tenant? How do you configure tenant settings, monitor usage, and provision licenses and other organizational resources? This learning path covers typical tasks and tools, such as the Power BI admin portal and Office 365 admin center. You will learn how to establish and provide governance for a Power BI environment and provision Power BI Premium capacity.

topItems.title: Understand the Power BI administrator role
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to administer Power BI to support business decisions backed by data.

topItems.title: Establish a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: This module covers topics relating to establishing a Power BI environment within Office 365 containers.

topItems.title: Provide governance in a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: Learn the fundamental rules, regulations, and policies of a BI governance approach.

topItems.title: Facilitate collaboration and sharing
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to collaborate and share dashboards and reports with coworkers.
